name: False Consensus Manufacturing
description: Creates impression of widespread agreement without evidence
psychological_mechanism: Bypasses individual judgment by appealing to imaginary group consensus

name: Crisis Language Amplification
description: Uses dramatic language to amplify perceived urgency and threat
psychological_mechanism: Triggers fight-or-flight response to bypass rational analysis

name: Vague Quantification
description: Uses imprecise numbers to create false impression of measurement
psychological_mechanism: Mimics scientific precision while avoiding actual data

name: Buried Data Limitations
description: Admits data weakness in subordinate clauses while maintaining authoritative tone
psychological_mechanism: Maintains authority impression while legally covering for weak data

name: False Limitation Framing
description: Artificially restricts scope or application to dismiss broader utility
psychological_mechanism: Reduces complex topics to oversimplified categories

name: Speculative Certainty
description: Presents speculation as probable fact without supporting evidence
psychological_mechanism: Creates false confidence in uncertain projections

name: Institutional Name-dropping
description: Uses institutional names without providing context for data quality
psychological_mechanism: Borrows institutional credibility without acknowledging limitations

name: Inevitability Framing
description: Presents changeable situations as unchangeable facts
psychological_mechanism: Reduces resistance by presenting problems as unchangeable
